section.title: Security Considerations
section.t:
When describing the server behavior, the language in the various manpages are not clear on the difference between:
The server bypasses any security authentication via the incoming request and simply anonymizes the credentials.
The server first ensures all security authentication via the incoming request's security flavor and only if accepted does it anonymmize the credentials.
In practice, the server should apply the authentication method requested by the client and only then anonymize the credentials.
Another concern would be when the server returns an authentication list which just contains AUTH_NONE. Does that imply that the server supports all possible security flavors?

The client can safely assume that the server supports both the security flavor it requested and AUTH_NONE. For example, if the server was not configured for Kerberos and hence did not have a valid ticket, it would not be able to process the incomming kerberized mount request from the client and would have not gotten down into the NFS/MOUNT layer to reply to the client with the list of security flavors.
